abstract: Arrests of several FIFA officials on corruption charges reinforces United States Soccer Federation Pres Sunil Gulati's decision to back challenger Prince Ali bin al-Hussein of Jordan rather than incumbent FIFA Pres Sepp Blatter in upcoming election; is aware that vote could have negative consequences for United States as Blatter is expected to win by wide margin.
lead_paragraph: Sunil Gulati said he would vote for Prince Ali bin al-Hussein to replace Sepp Blatter as FIFA president, even if it hurts U.S. Soccer’s chances to host another World Cup.

headline.main: U.S. Soccer Will Support Blatter Rival in FIFA Election
headline.print_headline: U.S. Soccer Set to Vote for Blatter’s Challenger

snippet: Sunil Gulati said he would vote for Prince Ali bin al-Hussein to replace Sepp Blatter as FIFA president, even if it hurts U.S. Soccer’s chances to host another World Cup.
